metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: 8. Click Next in the upper right corner of the window.

subsection_analysis.refined_text:
You can 
manually add text and other symbols anywhere on the form using the Fill & Sign tool if 
required. It displays the Fill & Sign tools in the left pane. Once you see a plus icon with arrows, move the textbox to the desired 
position.

Fill in interactive forms 
An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in. If necessary, select either the Hand Tool or the Select Tool from the context menu of 
the page (right-click on the page to open the context menu). The pointer changes to a different icon as you move it over a field.

Acrobat and Acrobat Reader users can use the Fill & Sign tool 
to fill in flat forms. See Create a form from an existing 
document. The tools are enabled for the current form only.

Click Next in the upper right corner of the window. Prepare the Agreement and Add Fields: 
You can now add any necessary fields to the agreement. • 
Allows resizing of fields by clicking the bottom right corner of the field (blue 
triangle) and dragging the field to size.

• 
Simplified mode for single signer 
If you've added one signer, the Advanced Editing mode is off, and you see the 
simplified option as shown below. Alternatively, 
drag fields from the tabs in the right pane and drop the fields where desired in the 
document. You receive an email from Acrobat Sign stating that the agreements have been sent to the 
first signer for signature.

Add a file: 
Upload (by search or drag-and-drop) the primary file that you are using to build 
your agreement template. The initial file selected to start the agreement template is already attached. Edit the Agreement settings (Optional): 
By default, agreements do not require a password to view the completed agreement, 
nor do they have reminders set for participants 
• 
Select Add access password if you require recipients to enter a password to 
open and view the signed PDF file.

The left pane provides information on getting signatures from others 
workflow. Request signatures – Add Cc, subject, message, More Options 
• 
If you don't want to use the More Options, skip the next optional step. • 
Specify authentication type like Email, Password, Social Identity, Knowledge-
Based Authentication, Phone, or Acrobat Sign.

Choose an appropriate printer in the Print dialog box. This option prints text that you’ve typed using the Add 
Text tool. • 
(Interactive or flat form) To print the form, the typed entries, and any 
comments on the form, choose Document And Markups.

As an admin, you must add users to the Admin Console using one of the methods described 
in Adobe Admin Console users. For more information, see Packaging apps via 
the Admin Console. Once you assign AI Assistant for Acrobat, the users must restart Acrobat 
to see AI Assistant.

When documents are distributed 
electronically, it's important that recipients can: 
• 
Verify document authenticity—confirming the identity of each person who signed the 
document 
• 
Verify document integrity—confirming that the document has not been altered in 
transit 
Certificate-based signatures provide both of these security services. They use third-party certificate authorities to provide independent identity 
validation. Once certificate-based digital IDs have been provided to end users, they can 
use Acrobat or Acrobat Reader software to sign PDF files and validate files they receive from 
others.
